name: Reddio NFT, Token and IPFS
description: Reddio APIs provide the layer 2 zkRollup APIs powered by StarkEx from StarkWare, enabling 0 gas fee on layer 2 and 10k TPS. This new zkRollup technology is being widely use by many NFT marketplaces, GameFi , Defi projects etc.

api_methods.name: GetAssetsbycontractinformation
api_methods.description: This request will return asset_id wrapped with return code and error code

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: TokenID of NFT(ERC721/ERC721M need this field)

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: Contract address of token (when type is ERC20/ERC721/ERC721M need this field, if type is ETH, then it can be ignore)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of token, Possible enum values is ETH, ERC20, ERC721, ERC721M

api_methods.name: GetAssetsdetailbyassetid
api_methods.description:
The API can query every asset_id that exists on reddio's system, if the FT/NFT is not on reddio's system, then the API will not work well

The API returns assets detail including contract_address, type, token_id(if type is ERC721 or ERC721M), quantum and token owners(owns by who)

api_methods.name: GetOrderbyOrderID
api_methods.description:
The API will return the order related to the order id

There are many informations it returns

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| order_id | the id of the order, it is the same value as sequence id |
| stark_key | the stark_key of who place the order |
| price | the price of the NFT, when need a human-readable value, display_price is the human-readable value |
| display_price | the price that human-readable |
| direction | 0 for sell, 1 for buy |
| amount | the amount to buy or sell |
| un_filled | how many tokens are unfilled |
| symbol | a structure contains base and quota token, also have token id in it |
| fee_rate | the fee_rate |
| token_type | the token type |
| token_id | the token ID |
| order_state | the state of the order |
| resp | if there has some error, the field will be set |

The enum value of order_state is

| Status | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Placed | 0 |
| Canceled | 1 |
| Filled | 2 |
| PartiallyFilled | 3 |
| ConditionallyCanceled | 4 |

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: the order id you want to query

api_methods.name: Listallcollections
api_methods.description:
The API lists all collections on Reddio's layer2 system.

The return field is like the following descrption

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| contract_address | The contract address |
| symbol | The symbol of |
| type | ERC721 or ERC721M |
| total_supply | Total Supply of the token |
| base_uri | The base uri of NFT |
| asset_type | The asset type is calculated by reddio, the definition is [here](https://docs.starkware.co/starkex/spot/shared/starkex-specific-concepts.html#computing_asset_info_asset_type_asset_id) |

api_methods.name: Balanceofstark_keyandasset_id
api_methods.description:
This API retrieves the balance of a stark_key and asset_id

The return values description

| **key** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| asset_id | The asset's id |
| contract_address | The contract address of ERC20/ERC721/ERC721, if the asset_id's type is ETH, it will return "eth" as a placeholder |
| token_id | The NFT token ID(this field is set when type is ERC721 or ERC721M) |
| base_uri | The NFT base uri(this field is set when type is ERC721 or ERC721M) |
| available | The available balance on layer 2. |
| frozen | The frozen balance on layer 2. |
| type | Type of token, Possible enum values is ETH, ERC20, ERC721, ERC721M |
| symbol | The symbol of ERC721/ERC721M or ERC20("ETH" for ETH) |
| decimals | The decimals of asset, for ETH is 18, ERC721/ERC721M is 1, and for ERC20, it is based the contracts, [here](https://medium.com/@jgm.orinoco/understanding-erc-20-token-contracts-a809a7310aa5) is more explain about decimals on Ethernum |
| quantum | quantum is a starkex concept, it is auto-set when the contract is registered to reddio. [here](https://docs.starkware.co/starkex/spot/shared/starkex-specific-concepts.html) is more explain about quantum |
| display_value | deprecated,use `available` instead |
| display_frozen | deprecated,use `frozen` instead |
| balance_available | The available balance represents on layer 2. Keep attention that it need to be converted with quantum and decimals if you need to use this field. All SDK hands this value, so most of the time you do not need to care about it. |
| balance_frozen | The frozen balance represents on layer 2. Keep attention that it need to be converted with quantum and decimals if you need to use this field. All SDK hands this value, so most of the time you do not need to care about it. |

parameters.name: stark_key
parameters.description: The stark_key which you want to check balance

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Which asset you want to check, you can get asset id in prevous assets APIs

api_methods.name: GetOrderInfo
api_methods.description:
This API is to get order related information, such as the asset id of base/quota tokens. nonce and vaults related to stark_key

**If you use SDKs(including java/unity/js), you do not need to care about the order info interface, it is already handled by SDK internally**

the contract1 and contract2 values are like

{type}:{contract_address}:{token_id}

There are many informations it returns

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| fee_rate | the upper fee_rate allowed by reddio and marketplace. that is, if reddio & marketplace charge's more then the rate, the order will fail |
| base_token | base token asset id, in general, if you trade using ETH for NFT, then the base token is ETH's asset id |
| fee_token | which token as a fee, in general, it is the same as base_token |
| lower_limit | the lower price of the NFT |
| nonce | the nonce of the stark_key |
| contracts | the contracts info of contract1 and contract2 |
| asset_ids | the asset ids of contract1 and contract2 |
| vault_ids | first vault id is generated by the stark_key and first asset id, the second vault id is generated by the stark_key and second asset id(you can see the asset_ids above) |

parameters.name: stark_key
parameters.description: the stark_key that want to buy or sell NFT

parameters.name: contract2
parameters.description: the quota contract and token id, the vaule can like ERC721:0xA21B04B6dbd1174155E242434B3Df2EeD74BaFb2:28

parameters.name: contract1
parameters.description: the base contract info, if sell using ETH, then the vaule should be ETH:eth:1

api_methods.name: SellanNFT
api_methods.description:
Sell an NFT sells an NFT

Body parameters

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| amount | the amount to sell |
| price | the price of the NFT |
| stark_key | the stark_key of the seller |
| amount_buy | the amount token to buy, the same value as price |
| amount_sell | 1 for NFT |
| token_buy | the base token's asset_id |
| token_sell | the NFT's asset_id |
| vault_id_buy | the vault id of base token |
| vault_id_sell | the vault id of quota token |
| expiration_timestamp | the expiration time, count in hour |
| base_token | base token's asset id |
| quote_token | quota token's asset id |
| nonce | the nonce of the seller |
| signature | the transaction's signature, can refer [here](https://github.com/reddio-com/red-py-sdk/blob/main/redpysdk/starkex_utils.py#L38-L41) to generate signature. In SDK it handled by sdk |
| fee_info | fee information(which fee will be taken and how much) |
| direction | 0 for sell, 1 for buy |
| marketplace_uuid | the uuid of marketplace(is used to charge fee) |

utterances.utterance: I want to sell my NFT for 2 ETH on the marketplace.
List my NFT for sale at 0.5 ETH with an expiration of 24 hours.
Sell my NFT with asset ID 12345 for 3 ETH.
Put my NFT on sale for 1.5 ETH and set the expiration to 48 hours.
I want to sell my NFT for 4 ETH with a specific marketplace UUID.
List my NFT for 0.8 ETH with a vault ID of 67890.
Sell my NFT for 2.5 ETH with a nonce value of 123.
I want to sell my NFT for 1 ETH and include fee information.
Put my NFT on sale for 3.5 ETH with a signature for the transaction.
Sell my NFT for 5 ETH using my stark key.

api_methods.name: TransferNFT
api_methods.description:
Body parameters

Transfer transfers tokens(asset_id) from stark_key to receiver

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| amount | the amount to be transferred. |
| nonce | the nonce of sender's stark_key |
| vault_id | the vault id of the sender with asset_id |
| receiver_vault_id | the vault id of the receiver with asset_id |
| stark_key | the sender's stark_key |
| receiver | the receiver's stark_key |
| signature | the transaction's signature, can refer [here](https://github.com/reddio-com/red-py-sdk/blob/main/redpysdk/starkex_utils.py#L46-L51) to generate signature. In SDK it handled by sdk |
| expiration_timestamp | the expiration time, count in hour |

utterances.utterance: Transfer 5 NFTs from my vault to the receiver's vault with a nonce of 12345.
Send 10 tokens from my stark key to the receiver's stark key with vault ID 67890.
Move 3 assets to the receiver's vault with ID 54321 and set the expiration to 24 hours.
Transfer 7 tokens using nonce 98765 from my stark key to the receiver's key.
Send 15 NFTs from my vault ID 11223 to the receiver's vault ID 33445.
Transfer 20 tokens with a nonce of 24680 to the receiver's stark key.
Move 8 assets from my stark key to the receiver's vault with ID 99887.
Send 12 NFTs to the receiver's stark key with a nonce of 13579.
Transfer 6 tokens from my vault ID 55667 to the receiver's vault ID 77889 with a 48-hour expiration.
Move 9 assets to the receiver's stark key with a nonce of 112233.

api_methods.name: WithdrawalaNFT
api_methods.description:
Withdrawal withdraw tokens(asset_id) from stark_key to receiver

| **field** | **description** |
| --- | --- |
| amount | the amount to be transferred. |
| nonce | the nonce of sender's stark_key |
| vault_id | the vault id of the sender with asset_id |
| receiver_vault_id | the vault id of the receiver with asset_id |
| stark_key | the sender's stark_key |
| receiver | which eth address to withdraw |
| signature | the transaction's signature, can refer [here](https://github.com/reddio-com/red-py-sdk/blob/main/redpysdk/starkex_utils.py#L46-L51) to generate signature. In SDK it handled by sdk |
| expiration_timestamp | the expiration time, count in hour |

utterances.utterance: Withdraw 5 tokens from my stark key to the receiver's Ethereum address.

Withdraw 25 tokens from vault ID 1111 to receiver vault ID 2222 with expiration in 24 hours.

Withdraw 35 tokens from my vault ID 3333 to the receiver's vault ID 4444 with a specific transaction signature.
Send 40 tokens from my stark key to the receiver's Ethereum address, expiring in 48 hours.
Withdraw 45 tokens using my stark key with nonce 77 to the receiver's Ethereum address.
Transfer 50 NFTs from vault ID 5555 to receiver vault ID 6666 with a transaction signature and expiration in 72 hours.
